Question Text: Which of the following command is used to generate an OpenFlow network topology consisting of a single switch and 8 hosts with randomly generated MAC addresses for each host?
Choices:
a. sudo mn --topo single,8  --switch ovsk --controller remote
b. sudo mn --topo single,3 --mac --switch ovsk --controller remote
c. sudo mn --topo single,8 --mac --switch ovsk --controller remote
d. sudo mn --topo linear,8  --switch ovsk --controller remote
LLM Explanation: The correct command to generate an OpenFlow network topology with a single switch and 8 hosts, each with randomly generated MAC addresses, is: sudo mn --topo single,8 --mac --switch ovsk --controller remote. The '--topo single,8' option specifies a single switch with 8 hosts, the '--mac' option enables random MAC address assignment for each host, '--switch ovsk' sets the switch type to Open vSwitch, and '--controller remote' configures the network to use a remote controller.
URLs: ['Mininet Walkthrough - Mininet Documentation (https://github.com/mininet/mininet/wiki/Walkthrough)', 'Introduction to Mininet - Open Networking Lab (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jmlgXaocwiE)']
SM - Description: Doesn’t know that —Mac is used for sequential generation of Mac addresses, not random
